variants.Description in input context: Identified missense variant in SNRPG1 associated with LGMD2Q
A silent variant, but shown to affect protein folding

Material used.Description: Experiments were performed using the hMSC cell line, differentiated into myotubes.

Readout description.Result Description: SNRPG1 protein levels were reduced by 95% in cells harboring the c.1234A>G variant.
The c.2487C>T variant resulted in a subtle change in the migration pattern of SNRPG1 protein, suggesting misfolding.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent differentiation experiments were performed (n=3).

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was loaded in duplicate (n=2).

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNRPG1 cDNA was transfected as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: SNRPG1 protein expression above the detection limit.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: SNRPG1 protein expression less than 10% of control.

Material used.Description: Human myoblasts were differentiated into myotubes.

Readout description.Result Description: The c.1234A>G variant resulted in absence of the SNRPG1 protein, visualized by immunofluorescence
The c.2487C>T variant produced an aggregation pattern, visible by immunofluorescence

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent differentiation experiments were performed (n=3).

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was loaded in duplicate (n=2).

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNRPG1 cDNA was transfected as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: SNRPG1 protein visualized in the nuclei.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence of the SNRPG1 protein, or an abnormal aggregation.
